summary: The Department of Energy is responsible for most of the U.S. government’s environmental cleanup costs. Much of DOE’s environmental liability comes from the cleanup of nuclear weapons production. We and others have long recommended that DOE adopt a risk-informed approach to making cleanup decisions—i.e., an approach that helps agencies prioritize cleanup based on factors like cost and the risks to human health and the environment...
title: Environmental Liabilities: DOE Would Benefit from Incorporating Risk-Informed Decision-Making into Its Cleanup Policy
